meanings.sent1: She was eternalizing their love by carving their initials on the tree.
meanings.sent2: The artist was eternalizing the beauty of the sunset in his painting.
meanings.sent3: The wizard eternalizing the spell in the ancient book made a mistake and turned himself into a frog.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the halls, eternalizing the joy of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The old clock seemed to be eternalizing time itself with its steady ticking.

meanings.definition: To give eternal qualities to something.
meanings.sent1: The fairy godmother was eternalizing the pumpkin into a magical carriage.
meanings.sent2: The poet's words eternalized the beauty of the meadow in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret sauce had the power of eternalizing any dish it touched.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ritual was believed to eternalize the spirits of the ancestors in the sacred tree.
meanings.sent5: The golden statue eternalized the bravery of the fallen soldiers for generations to come.

meanings.definition: The act of making something eternal.
meanings.sent1: The eternalizing of their vows brought tears to everyone's eyes.
meanings.sent2: The eternalizing of memories in photographs helps us cherish special moments.
meanings.sent3: The eternalizing of the ancient artifact in the museum was a cause for celebration.
meanings.sent4: The eternalizing of his legacy through his writings ensured he would never be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The eternalizing of her spirit in the beautiful song touched the hearts of all who listened.
